intro: Castilleja communis f. johnstoniae, commonly known as Johnston's common castilleja, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is characterized by its red to orange-red flowers and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with the roots of other plants, deriving some of its nutrients from them. It is native to the western United States, particularly in areas of California and Oregon. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native range.
